creator: DD46

content:
Let's try the simplest way first (but do SAVE the exported profile you created earlier, as we may need it). - if the profile is less than 2gb, the simple way is to click tools>export on windows PC and tools>import on LInux PC. You would need to reenter passwords, but the transfer would be complete.

Now, if that doesn't work, then let's use your previously exported profile. We will use a suggested approach from this URL: https://kb.mozillazine.org/Moving_your_profile_folder_-_Thunderbird

  1. On the Linux PC, click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profiles' and and click 'about:profiles'
  3. click the 'create profile' button in upper left
  4. click next
  5. enter a short name for the new profile, such as NEWPROFILE
  6. click Finish
  7. the new profile should now appear on the screen
  8. click the 'open folder' button for the new profile in the roaming\thunderbird\profiles directory
  9. paste the contents of your exported profile here, save it, and then launch it.

content:
Translation: When we turned on the PC this morning, our drafts were gone; they were still there yesterday. They are no longer traceable. It's as if they've vanished. Is there a way to restore the drafts?

Sie könnten versuchen, den Entwürfe-Ordner zu reparieren. Klicken Sie mit der rechten Maustaste auf den Ordnernamen, wählen Sie "Eigenschaften", und klicken Sie dann auf "Ordner reparieren".

You could try repairing the drafts folder. Right click on the folder name, select Properties, then click on "Repair Folder".

Ist ein Schnellfilter eingestellt? Verwenden Sie eine Antivirensoftware?

Is a quick filter set? Are you using anti-virus software?

content: You didn't specify which version you use. Thunderbird has an ESR version and a monthly version. The ESR has major updates annually, which would the version I would recommend for you. And, in settings>general, you can specify to NOT AUTOMATICALLY update, but let you decide. The download site is at https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ Finally, Thunderbird NEVER asks that the password change. When you do receive such a request, Thunderbird is only relaying that information from your email provider to you.

content: You may need to disable the experimental account hub first. content: hello david, thanks, but it´s not about how many email accounts TB can handle. it´s about how many user accounts on one computer it can allow, if there is such a rule or limit. so for example it´s 3 users, all use this one computer. everytime one user logs in (to windows) at first TB is empty and the user can setup the connection to exchange. the first two users could do this but the third can not. thank you Andi
creator: andi.will.0175

content:
Thunderbird stores all of it's user data in the users %appdata% locations on windows , as you would know those are domain user dependent and access is not shared between users. So user 1 should not even have any data available for user 2 to even find. Unless you have installed Thunderbird using an administrator login and pointed the profile to somewhere other than the default locations for each user no user should have access the profile data of another.

So there could be a limit only in how many domain users can log into the computer (disk space for their remote and local data or memory if they are switching users.)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
hello matt, correct, each user has it´s own area, can not see or access other user´s data, files etc. so thunderbird is installed once and every user can use it, like word or paint.

every user has enough space localy and on the servers...

meanwhile i found OWL for TB an i found TBSync for TB - this addons make sure you can connect to a exchange server or 365 enviroment.

TBsync is only working until TB 140 i think and OWL is not for free.

on top of that we have to think about to uninstall exchange and change to another system because like with windows 10, the support is ended with exchange server.

but the question is still, if there are addons like OWL to connect TB to exchange server, how was it possible for me to successfully connect 2 users to their exchange account with working emails and the third user can not connect. in the profile / connection settings if i try now to connect third user, there is a message i have to usw OWL

kind regards Andi
creator: andi.will.0175

content:
Sounds like a problem with your server - Thunderbird would introduce no concurrency issues.

As far as EWS, if you manage the server then you determine how long it remains operational.

Your choices with Thunderbird are to either use OWL, or (if you don't need calendar and address book support) you can use upcoming Thunderbird version 145. You can try 145 in beta https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-beta

content:
Forse non hai letto con attenzione la guida che ti ho segnalato:

i file mbox per le cartelle predefinite di Thunderbird avranno quindi il nome della cartella ma in inglese: inbox (in arrivo), sent (inviate), trash (cestino), junk (spam), etc.

Se poi non ci sono neppure i file con il nome in inglese, allora non c'è nulla da fare.

Per la questione del contatto: Questo è solo un forum di utenti. Va da sé che un software gratuito come Thunderbird non abbia le risorse per fornire un supporto tecnico tradizionale.

creator: sfhowes

content:
Hi Mikael,

I rarely use threads, so I am no expert, and I do not know what may have changed over time. But I see in version 144.0.1 that data in the top message of a thread is undercored when there is an unread message in the thread. Do you see that?

I believe that threads are designed to sort in ascending chronological order at all times. That is their purpose: to show how discussions have flowed since the first message.

If you want to control sorting by date, you may want to use the conversations view. I keep a button for it on my main toolbar so I can access the conversation view for any discussion in one click.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird
creator: mozilla98

content: See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1442668#answer-1642934

content: - click the account in folder pane - rightclick and select 'subscribe' - untick the box for allmail (and also Important if that folder is ticked) The Allmail folder and Important folder are duplicates of your other folders. - after doing so, you can remove the now unneeded disk space by clicking help>troubleshootinginformmation, scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder', and then exiting thunderbird, and then clicking the imapmail folder, followed by clicking the Gmail account folder and then delete the allmail,allmail.msf, important, important.msf, and then restart thunderbird. :)
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks. After unsubscribing I shut down my laptop and when I restarted the Allmail files had already disappeared. I had not thought that this would prevent searching Allmail on my laptop but I can still do this on my mobile. I presume everything will go back to as it was before if I subscribe to Allmail again - I am going to do this next. Then I shall have a rethink and maybe instead delete some substantial ImapMail folders that are redundant.
creator: msturdy77

content: You're welcome. Just a reminder: in searching Allmail, the only unique messages you will find will be the ones that are not in inbox, sent, or any of your other subscribed folders. Accessing Allmail also doubles your time to send and receive mail and increases all resource usage.
creator: davidsk

content: As it happens, after restarting my laptop with Allmail subscription renewed, Thunderbird managed to include it again using about 2GB less than before. So problem solved anyway. Thanks

content:
The SMTP server settings are as follows, Server name: smtp.gmail.com Port: 465 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2 User name: name@gmail.com

Incoming mail settings probably don't matter, but they are Server name: imap.gmail.com Port: 993 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2 User name: name@gmail.com

content:
YC72 said
Hello, I am unable to create two different Orange accounts in Thunderbird since changing to a Windows 11 PC. It worked perfectly before with Windows 10. Thank you for your assistance. Kind regards,

First, disable account hub in Settings/General, then add the account from ≡ - New Account - Email.

Make sure you use a 3rd-party app password in place of the account password.

https://assistance.orange.fr/ordinateurs-peripheriques/installer-et-utiliser/l-utilisation-du-mail-et-du-cloud/mail-orange/le-mail-orange-nouvelle-version/parametrer-la-boite-mail/mail-orange-comment-acceder-a-sa-boite-mail-orange-depuis-une-application-ou-un-logiciel-de-messagerie-non-fourni-par-orange_434630-964290#
